      Add a new billing account information and credit card on file.

      Target API Endpoint: /billing/create

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account used to perform the the request SirqulKeys.firstName
      The first name on the credit card SirqulKeys.lastName
      The last name on the credit card SirqulKeys.address
      The billing address of the credit card SirqulKeys.city
      The billing city of the credit card SirqulKeys.state
      The billing state of the credit card SirqulKeys.postalCode
      The billing zip code of the credit card SirqulKeys.phone
      The billing phone of the credit card SirqulKeys.creditCardNumber
      The full credit card number to store on file SirqulKeys.expirationDate
      The credit card expiration date YYYY-MM SirqulKeys.ccv
      The 3 digit confirmation code SirqulKeys.paymentMethodNickname
      The nickname to give the payment method SirqulKeys.defaultPaymentMethod
      Whether this should be the default payment method SirqulKeys.authToken
      an authorization token for providers that provide this (like Amazon Payments) SirqulKeys.provider
      the payment provider (see Enums.PaymentMethodProvider)
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      a PaymentTypesResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message

    • Method Detail

      • addPaymentMethod

        public void addPaymentMethod(Map<String,Object> params,
                    ISirqulCallback<PaymentTypesResponse> callback)
        Add a new billing account information and credit card on file.

        Target API Endpoint: /billing/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the the request
        • SirqulKeys.firstName
          The first name on the credit card
        • SirqulKeys.lastName
          The last name on the credit card
        • SirqulKeys.address
          The billing address of the credit card
        • SirqulKeys.city
          The billing city of the credit card
        • SirqulKeys.state
          The billing state of the credit card
        • SirqulKeys.postalCode
          The billing zip code of the credit card
        • SirqulKeys.phone
          The billing phone of the credit card
        • SirqulKeys.creditCardNumber
          The full credit card number to store on file
        • SirqulKeys.expirationDate
          The credit card expiration date YYYY-MM
        • SirqulKeys.ccv
          The 3 digit confirmation code
        • SirqulKeys.paymentMethodNickname
          The nickname to give the payment method
        • SirqulKeys.defaultPaymentMethod
          Whether this should be the default payment method
        • SirqulKeys.authToken
          an authorization token for providers that provide this (like Amazon Payments)
        • SirqulKeys.provider
          the payment provider (see Enums.PaymentMethodProvider)

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a PaymentTypesResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        BillingInfoObject.addPaymentMethod

        public void purchaseWithCardOnFile(Map<String,Object> params,
                          ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Purchase an offer with the credit card on file.

        Target API Endpoint: /billing/purchase/cardonfile

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account used to perform the the request
        • SirqulKeys.offerId
          The ID of the offer being purchased (either offerId or offerLocationId is required)
        • SirqulKeys.offerLocationId
          The ID of the offer location being purchased (either offerId or offerLocationId is required)
        • SirqulKeys.offerTransactionId
          The ID of the offer transaction being updated (either offerId, offerLocationId, or offerTransactionId is required)

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message if success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods.
